body.p: To configure as an external search engine in Oxygen WebHelp Responsive output, you must activate the indexing functionality in the current version of the particular site configuration. This functionality requires the output to be generated using Oxygen WebHelp version 25 or later.

The content indexing plays a critical role in the search process by serving as a map or guide that enables Oxygen Feedback to quickly and efficiently locate relevant content based on user queries. When Oxygen Feedback crawls the WebHelp Responsive output, it indexes the content of each page creating a searchable record of the HTML content.
The index stores information about the content of each page, including the text and the page title, as well as metadata such as keywords, index terms and description.

The content indexing functionality can be enabled from the Content Indexing and Search section that is available in the Version Settings page.Oxygen Feedback indexes the HTML content available at the Base URL of the current site configuration version.
